Definition: The issue report requires a custom build configuration that differs from the default or standard build process.

Label: multiple-commits
Definition: The issue report should be labeled with '''multiple-commits''' if it involves or is related to the following:- Merging multiple commits into a single pull request.- Resolving conflicts caused by multiple commits.- Issues resulting from committing multiple changes in a single commit.- Problems with Git history due to multiple commits.- Feature requests or discussions about best practices for committing multiple changes.

Label: scope
Definition: The issue report is related to a specific feature or component of the project.

Label: exported-classes
Definition: The issue report involves exported classes from a codebase
column3: such as:- Issues related to public class visibility or accessibility.- Class naming conflicts or collisions.- Class dependencies or imports.- Class inheritance or polymorphism.- Exporting classes with specific characteristics (e.g.
column6: etc.).- Class annotations or attributes.- Exporting classes from a specific module or package.- Issues with class serialization or deserialization.- Class versioning or compatibility issues.

Label: aliasing
Definition: The issue report involves confusion between two or more objects
column4: or references that refer to the same resource
column5: leading to unexpected behavior or incorrect results due to referencing the same data in different ways.

Label: module-structure
Definition: The issue report should be assigned the label "module-structure" if it is related to:- Improving or reorganizing the overall structure of the codebase
column3: including but not limited to:  * Refactoring modules or packages  * Renaming or reorganizing module directories  * Merging or splitting modules  * Improving module dependencies or imports- Questions or discussions about the best practices for structuring code in the project- Proposals for new module structures or layouts

Label: namespace
Definition: The issue report should involve a problem or question related to the use of namespaces in a programming context.

Label: class-scoping
Definition: The issue report should involve a problem or question related to the scoping of classes in a programming language
column3: such as:- Class variable accessibility- Class member visibility- Inner class scoping- Static class variables- Class inheritance and scoping- Conflict between class scoping rules- Any other issue that affects how classes are scoped in a program.

Label: blob
Definition: The issue report is related to a file content change
column3: such as a code modification or a file deletion.
